titleStmt.title: The second lash of Alazonomastix, laid on in mercie upon that stubborn youth Eugenius Philalethes, or, A sober reply to a very uncivill answer to certain observations upon Anthroposophia theomagica, and Anima magica abscondita
titleStmt.author: More, Henry, 1614-1687.

titleStmt.title: The second lash of Alazonomastix, laid on in mercie upon that stubborn youth Eugenius Philalethes, or, A sober reply to a very uncivill answer to certain observations upon Anthroposophia theomagica, and Anima magica abscondita
titleStmt.author: More, Henry, 1614-1687.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the printers to the University of Cambridge,

notesStmt.note: Added extra t.p.: The second lash of Alazonomastix : conteining a solid and serious reply to a very uncivill answer to certain observations upon Anthroposophia theomagica, and Anima magica abscondita.
Attributed by Wing and NUC pre-1956 imprints to More.
A reply to Thomas Vaughan's The man-mouse taken in a trap. Vaughan answered with The second wash, or, The moore scour'd once more."--NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in Harvard University Library.

person.persName: the printers to the University of Cambridge
